newsitem.title: NORWAY: Oil loadings resume at Statfjord, Gullfaks fields.
newsitem.headline: Oil loadings resume at Statfjord, Gullfaks fields.

text.p: Crude loadings at the Norwegian North Sea Statfjord and Gullfaks fields were back to normal on Wednesday following a brief disruption due to storms, operator Den norske stats oljeselskap ASA said.
Shuttle tankers were able to moor up to the offshore loading buoys just before midnight on Tuesday, Statoil spokesman Odd Jan Lange said.
Loadings were suspended earlier on Tuesday morning, but oil production was not disrupted by the interruption.
"We started loading before midnight, one tanker at Statfjord and one at Gullfaks," Lange said.
On Monday the main Statfjord field pumped 471,750 barrels, with the Statfjord North and East satellites adding a further 125,800 barrels.
Saga Petroleum's Snorre field, which feeds crude to Statfjord for processing and transportation, produced 228,880 barrels.

Output at the Gullfaks development was still returning to normal following a scheduled maintenance shutdown. Production on Monday amounted to 377,400 barrels, about 70,000 barrels short of usual levels.
